name: Mansion of the Game Maker
description:
Hello and welcome to the mansion of the gamemaker. 

Your mission? To escape from this clearly enchanted mansion, where reality changes depending on our point of view. Move from room to room and puzzle to puzzle to find your way out, while trying not to get your mind turned upside down! 

Lost? How to play

 Mansion of the game maker is a puzzle game based on the use of tokens. Normally a token has two sides with two different symbols, but here the reality is quite different. The token have two sides and two symbols, but only one of the symbols is visible, depending on which side of the room you are in. 

Don't understand what "side of the room" means? 

Look up... yes, you are not dreaming! the same room as the one you are in is floating above your head. The only difference is that it does not have the same atmosphere as the one you are in. 2 atmospheres (day/night), 2 symbols, one lights up while the other disappears, depending on which side you are in.

Your goal is to open the doors, by placing the right tokens on the locks (1 lock per room)

To do this, you will have to trick your way from one side of the room to the other, using the pillars and the lever. Because yes, they can't go through the door that allows you to be on the other side. 

Follow the tokens and keep in mind their symbols, because once in the other room, this one will change!

How the pillars work 

 The pillars are connected to each other and allow you to exchange two tokens. In order to exchange two tokens, they must match the symbol on the pillar. Be careful, the corresponding symbol does not have to be the visible symbol. When a token is placed on a pillar, it lights up. 

Now, you just have to press the button to exchange the tokens.

The connected pillars are one above/below the other.

How the lever works

The lever allows to change the gravity, so all the tokens above fall down and all the tokens in the room go up

tips 

Ton't hesitate to take notes, it can be useful, it's a puzzle game after all ;)
